text: The women's quadruple sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-eight finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Olympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Tuesday 27 August 2019 || 11:55 || Heats |- | Thursday 29 August 2019 || 13:27 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Saturday 31 August 2019 || 12:24 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 15:14 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== Heat winners advanced directly to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Olivia van Rooijen Inge Janssen Sophie Souwer Nicole Beukers | align="left"| | 6:17.96 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Agnieszka Kobus-Zawojska Marta Wieliczko Maria Springwald Katarzyna Zillmann | align="left"| | 6:18.75 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Daniela Schultze Michaela Stälberg Franziska Kampmann Frieda Hämmerling | align="left"| | 6:20.46 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Lauren Schmetterling Sophia Vitas Emily Huelskamp Kathryn Roach | align="left"| | 6:21.72 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Ludovica Serafini Silvia Terrazzi Clara Guerra Chiara Ondoli | align="left"| | 6:26.48 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Tabita Maftei Larisa Elena Roşu Elena Logofatu Nicoleta Pascanu | align="left"| | 6:38.80 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Chen Yunxia Zhang Ling Lü Yang Cui Xiaotong | align="left"| | 6:18.12 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Kirstyn Goodger Ruby Tew Samantha Voss Hannah Osborne | align="left"| | 6:23.66 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Jessica Leyden Melissa Wilson Mathilda Hodgkins-Byrne Charlotte Hodgkins-Byrne | align="left"| | 6:25.63 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Iuliia Volgina Hanna Prakhatsen Aleksandra Bolshakova Ekaterina Kurochkina | align="left"| | 6:30.70 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Rowena Meredith Katrina Bateman Fiona Ewing Cara Grzeskowiak | align="left"| | 6:31.78 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Violaine Aernoudts Margaux Bailleul Julie Voirin Anne-Sophie Marzin | align="left"| | 6:40.22 | R |} ===Repechages=== The two fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Agnieszka Kobus-Zawojska Marta Wieliczko Maria Springwald Katarzyna Zillmann | align="left"| | 6:12.10 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Jessica Leyden Melissa Wilson Mathilda Hodgkins-Byrne Charlotte Hodgkins-Byrne | align="left"| | 6:13.82 | FA |- | 3 | align="left"|Lauren Schmetterling Sophia Vitas Emily Huelskamp Kathryn Roach | align="left"| | 6:14.00 | FB |- | 4 | align="left"|Tabita Maftei Larisa Elena Roşu Elena Logofatu Nicoleta Pascanu | align="left"| | 6:24.06 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Rowena Meredith Katrina Bateman Fiona Ewing Cara Grzeskowiak | align="left"| | 6:29.73 | FB |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Daniela Schultze Michaela Stälberg Franziska Kampmann Frieda Hämmerling | align="left"| | 6:14.70 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Kirstyn Goodger Ruby Tew Samantha Voss Hannah Osborne | align="left"| | 6:16.37 | FA |- | 3 | align="left"|Ludovica Serafini Silvia Terrazzi Clara Guerra Chiara Ondoli | align="left"| | 6:16.74 | FB |- | 4 | align="left"|Iuliia Volgina Hanna Prakhatsen Aleksandra Bolshakova Ekaterina Kurochkina | align="left"| | 6:26.58 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Violaine Aernoudts Margaux Bailleul Julie Voirin Anne-Sophie Marzin | align="left"| | 6:33.16 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the B final. ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Lauren Schmetterling Sophia Vitas Emily Huelskamp Kathryn Roach | align="left"| | 6:40.11 |- | 2 | align="left"|Ludovica Serafini Silvia Terrazzi Clara Guerra Chiara Ondoli | align="left"| | 6:45.86 |- | 3 | align="left"|Iuliia Volgina Hanna Prakhatsen Aleksandra Bolshakova Ekaterina Kurochkina | align="left"| | 6:47.90 |- | 4 | align="left"|Rowena Meredith Katrina Bateman Fiona Ewing Cara Grzeskowiak | align="left"| | 6:49.44 |- | 5 | align="left"|Tabita Maftei Larisa Elena Roşu Elena Logofatu Nicoleta Pascanu | align="left"| | 6:51.42 |- | 6 | align="left"|Violaine Aernoudts Margaux Bailleul Julie Voirin Anne-Sophie Marzin | align="left"| | 6:56.39 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Chen Yunxia Zhang Ling Lü Yang Cui Xiaotong | align="left"| | 6:34.65 |- | | align="left"|Agnieszka Kobus- Zawojska Marta Wieliczko Maria Springwald Katarzyna Zillmann | align="left"| | 6:36.59 |- | | align="left"|Olivia van Rooijen Inge Janssen Sophie Souwer Nicole Beukers | align="left"| | 6:36.62 |- | 4 | align="left"|Daniela Schultze Michaela Stälberg Franziska Kampmann Frieda Hämmerling | align="left"| | 6:45.11 |- | 5 | align="left"|Kirstyn Goodger Ruby Tew Samantha Voss Hannah Osborne | align="left"| | 6:46.55 |- | 6 | align="left"|Jessica Leyden Melissa Wilson Mathilda Hodgkins-Byrne Charlotte Hodgkins-Byrne | align="left"| | 6:46.84 |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships World
title: 2019 World Rowing Championships – Women's quadruple sculls
